Power of Housing Corporation to delegate functions etc.
	In Schedule 6 to the Housing Associations Act [1985 (c.69)](/id/ukpga/1985/69?view=plain "Go to item of legislation") (constitutionof Housing Corporation), after paragraph 6 insert—
	“Delegation of functions
		6AThe Housing Corporation may delegate the exercise of any of its functions toany of its members, committees, sub-committees or employees.”
		The Housing Corporation is to be taken to have been authorised, at alltimes before the passing of this Act, to delegate the exercise of any of itsfunctions to any of its members, committees, sub-committees or employees; andHousing for Wales is to be taken to have been so authorised at all timesbefore its abolition.
		Anything which purports to have been done before the passing of this Act bythe Housing Corporation or Housing for Wales is to be taken to have beenvalidly done if done or evidenced by a document duly executed under its seal.
		If the fixing of the seal of the Housing Corporation or Housing for Waleshas, at any time before the passing of this Act, been authenticated by thesignature of any of its members or employees it is to be regarded as havingbeen properly authenticated.
Short title and extent
	This Act may be cited as the Housing Corporation (Delegation) etc. Act2006.
	This Act extends to England and Wales and Scotland.
